question: Which among the following is known as Gresham’s Law?
option1: Good Money (if not limited in quantity) drives out bad money out of circulation
option2: Bad Money (if not limited in quantity) drives out Good money out of circulation
option3: Good Money (if limited in quantity) drives out bad money out of circulation
option4: Bad Money (if limited in quantity) drives out Good money out of circulation
answer: Bad Money (if not limited in quantity) drives out Good money out of circulation
explanation: Bad Money (if not limited in quantity) drives out Good money out of circulation – This statement was given by Sir Thomas Gresham, the Economic adviser of Queen Elizabeth. This law states that people always want to hoard Good Money and spend Bad Money when two forms of Money are in circulation at the same time.
